channel.title: Lamboginny Music World
channel.description: Recent content on Lamboginny Music World

item.title: Background on Lamboginny
item.description: Background on Lamboginny Today we are launching Yinka Lawanson Lamboginny’s web site. Yinka Lawanson was born in 1985 in Lagos, Nigeria and got the stage name Lamboginny as a nick name from his father. In his early twenties, Lamboginny was inspired by artists like the late Bob Marley and Afrobeat music creator “Fela Anikulapo Kuti” who used their voices and music for more than entertainment. After about ten years signing under various record labels, Lamboginny asked himself “Who am I?

item.title: Contact
item.description: You have something to say? We look forward to hearing from you and will respond as soon as possible.

item.title: FAQ
item.description: 1. How did you get the name Lamboginny? That started from the fact that he was a marine engineer and he was always travelling. When he was home he would like ot relax and I would be all over him. One day he was trying to distract me and sent me to do some chores, the speed at which I did them and came back made him ask if I was now as fast as a Lamborghini automobile.

item.title: Music
item.description: Follow on Spotify Stream on Spotify CLICK HERE TO SEE ALL STREAMING OPTIONS SALT is Lamboginny’s debut album as an indepenent artist and was released in October 2017 at the Kirikiri medium security prison in Lagos Nigeria. 0 - Intro - Sea Sound - Featuring DJ Jimmy Jatt 1 - Salt - Produced by STO 2 - KorKor - Featureing Korede Bello - Produced by Bennie Maccauly 3 - Read My Lips - Featuring Olamide - Produced by STO 4 - Hustle & Pray - Produced by STO 5 - Keep On Moving - Featuring Muna - Produced by STO 6 - Blessed - Produced by STO 7 - Yebo - Featuring Mr.

item.title: Photos
item.description: SALT is Lamboginny’s debut album as an indepenent artist and was released October 12, 2017 at the Kirikiri medium security prison in Lagos Nigeria. Lamboginny traveling by boat to Ebola-affected areas to help provide awareness and education to the affected communities.
